00019 # Global default settings:
00020 #
00021 
00022 # Change to ">" for HTML output
00023 @define( 'MARKDOWN_EMPTY_ELEMENT_SUFFIX',  " />");
00024 
00025 # Define the width of a tab for code blocks.
00026 @define( 'MARKDOWN_TAB_WIDTH',     4 );
00027 
00028 
00029 #
00030 # WordPress settings:
00031 #

00038 
00039 ### Standard Function Interface ###
00040 
00041 @define( 'MARKDOWN_PARSER_CLASS',  'Markdown_Parser' );
00042 
00043 function Markdown($text) {
00044 #
00045 # Initialize the parser and return the result of its transform method.
00046 #
00047         # Setup static parser variable.
00048         static $parser;
00049         if (!isset($parser)) {
00050                 $parser_class = MARKDOWN_PARSER_CLASS;
00051                 $parser = new $parser_class;
00052         }
00053 
00054         # Transform text using parser.
00055         return $parser->transform($text);
00056 }

Based on the original Perl version by <a href="http://daringfireball.net/">John Gruber</a>. <a href="http://www.michelf.com/projects/php-markdown/">More...</a>
00065 Version: 1.0.1k
00066 Author: Michel Fortin
00067 Author URI: http://www.michelf.com/

00070 if (isset($wp_version)) {
00071         # More details about how it works here:
00072         # <http://www.michelf.com/weblog/2005/wordpress-text-flow-vs-markdown/>
00073         
00074         # Post content and excerpts
00075         # - Remove WordPress paragraph generator.
00076         # - Run Markdown on excerpt, then remove all tags.
00077         # - Add paragraph tag around the excerpt, but remove it for the excerpt rss.
00078         if (MARKDOWN_WP_POSTS) {
00079                 remove_filter('the_content',     'wpautop');
00080         remove_filter('the_content_rss', 'wpautop');
00081                 remove_filter('the_excerpt',     'wpautop');
00082                 add_filter('the_content',     'Markdown', 6);
00083         add_filter('the_content_rss', 'Markdown', 6);
00084                 add_filter('get_the_excerpt', 'Markdown', 6);
00085                 add_filter('get_the_excerpt', 'trim', 7);
00086                 add_filter('the_excerpt',     'mdwp_add_p');
00087                 add_filter('the_excerpt_rss', 'mdwp_strip_p');
00088                 
00089                 remove_filter('content_save_pre',  'balanceTags', 50);
00090                 remove_filter('excerpt_save_pre',  'balanceTags', 50);
00091                 add_filter('the_content',         'balanceTags', 50);
00092                 add_filter('get_the_excerpt', 'balanceTags', 9);
00093         }
00094         
00095         # Comments
00096         # - Remove WordPress paragraph generator.
00097         # - Remove WordPress auto-link generator.
00098         # - Scramble important tags before passing them to the kses filter.
00099         # - Run Markdown on excerpt then remove paragraph tags.
00100         if (MARKDOWN_WP_COMMENTS) {
00101                 remove_filter('comment_text', 'wpautop', 30);
00102                 remove_filter('comment_text', 'make_clickable');
00103                 add_filter('pre_comment_content', 'Markdown', 6);
00104                 add_filter('pre_comment_content', 'mdwp_hide_tags', 8);
00105                 add_filter('pre_comment_content', 'mdwp_show_tags', 12);
00106                 add_filter('get_comment_text',    'Markdown', 6);
00107                 add_filter('get_comment_excerpt', 'Markdown', 6);
00108                 add_filter('get_comment_excerpt', 'mdwp_strip_p', 7);
00109         
00110                 global $mdwp_hidden_tags, $mdwp_placeholders;
00111                 $mdwp_hidden_tags = explode(' ',
00112                         '<p> </p> <pre> </pre> <ol> </ol> <ul> </ul> <li> </li>');
00113                 $mdwp_placeholders = explode(' ', str_rot13(
00114                         'pEj07ZbbBZ U1kqgh4w4p pre2zmeN6K QTi31t9pre ol0MP1jzJR '.
00115                         'ML5IjmbRol ulANi1NsGY J7zRLJqPul liA8ctl16T K9nhooUHli'));
00116         }
00117         
00118         function mdwp_add_p($text) {
00119                 if (!preg_match('{^$|^<(p|ul|ol|dl|pre|blockquote)>}i', $text)) {
00120                         $text = '<p>'.$text.'</p>';
00121                         $text = preg_replace('{\n{2,}}', "</p>\n\n<p>", $text);
00122                 }
00123                 return $text;
00124         }
00125         
00126         function mdwp_strip_p($t) { return preg_replace('{</?p>}i', '', $t); }
00127 
00128         function mdwp_hide_tags($text) {
00129                 global $mdwp_hidden_tags, $mdwp_placeholders;
00130                 return str_replace($mdwp_hidden_tags, $mdwp_placeholders, $text);
00131         }
00132         function mdwp_show_tags($text) {
00133                 global $mdwp_hidden_tags, $mdwp_placeholders;
00134                 return str_replace($mdwp_placeholders, $mdwp_hidden_tags, $text);
00135         }
00136 }

00162 ### Textile Compatibility Mode ###
00163 
00164 # Rename this file to "classTextile.php" and it can replace Textile everywhere.
00165 
00166 if (strcasecmp(substr(__FILE__, -16), "classTextile.php") == 0) {
00167         # Try to include PHP SmartyPants. Should be in the same directory.
00168         @include_once 'smartypants.php';
00169         # Fake Textile class. It calls Markdown instead.
00170         class Textile {
00171                 function TextileThis($text, $lite='', $encode='') {
00172                         if ($lite == '' && $encode == '')    $text = Markdown($text);
00173                         if (function_exists('SmartyPants'))  $text = SmartyPants($text);
00174                         return $text;
00175                 }
00176                 # Fake restricted version: restrictions are not supported for now.
00177                 function TextileRestricted($text, $lite='', $noimage='') {
00178                         return $this->TextileThis($text, $lite);
00179                 }
00180                 # Workaround to ensure compatibility with TextPattern 4.0.3.
00181                 function blockLite($text) { return $text; }
00182         }
00183 }

00187 #
00188 # Markdown Parser Class
00189 #
00190 
00191 class Markdown_Parser {
00192 
00193         # Regex to match balanced [brackets].
00194         # Needed to insert a maximum bracked depth while converting to PHP.
00195         var $nested_brackets_depth = 6;
00196         var $nested_brackets;
00197         
00198         var $nested_url_parenthesis_depth = 4;
00199         var $nested_url_parenthesis;
00200 
00201         # Table of hash values for escaped characters:
00202         var $escape_chars = '\`*_{}[]()>#+-.!';
00203 
00204         # Change to ">" for HTML output.
00205         var $empty_element_suffix = MARKDOWN_EMPTY_ELEMENT_SUFFIX;
00206         var $tab_width = MARKDOWN_TAB_WIDTH;
00207         
00208         # Change to `true` to disallow markup or entities.
00209         var $no_markup = false;
00210         var $no_entities = false;
00211 
00212 
00213         function Markdown_Parser() {
00214         #
00215         # Constructor function. Initialize appropriate member variables.
00216         #
00217                 $this->_initDetab();
00218         
00219                 $this->nested_brackets = 
00220                         str_repeat('(?>[^\[\]]+|\[', $this->nested_brackets_depth).
00221                         str_repeat('\])*', $this->nested_brackets_depth);
00222         
00223                 $this->nested_url_parenthesis = 
00224                         str_repeat('(?>[^()\s]+|\(', $this->nested_url_parenthesis_depth).
00225                         str_repeat('(?>\)))*', $this->nested_url_parenthesis_depth);
00226                 
00227                 # Sort document, block, and span gamut in ascendent priority order.
00228                 asort($this->document_gamut);
00229                 asort($this->block_gamut);
00230                 asort($this->span_gamut);
00231         }
00232 
00233 
00234         # Internal hashes used during transformation.
00235         var $urls = array();
00236         var $titles = array();
00237         var $html_hashes = array();
00238         
00239         # Status flag to avoid invalid nesting.
00240         var $in_anchor = false;
00241 
00242 
00243         function transform($text) {
00244         #
00245         # Main function. The order in which other subs are called here is
00246         # essential. Link and image substitutions need to happen before
00247         # _EscapeSpecialCharsWithinTagAttributes(), so that any *'s or _'s in the <a>
00248         # and <img> tags get encoded.
00249         #
00250                 # Clear the global hashes. If we don't clear these, you get conflicts
00251                 # from other articles when generating a page which contains more than
00252                 # one article (e.g. an index page that shows the N most recent
00253                 # articles):
00254                 $this->urls = array();
00255                 $this->titles = array();
00256                 $this->html_hashes = array();
00257 
00258                 # Standardize line endings:
00259                 #   DOS to Unix and Mac to Unix
00260                 $text = preg_replace('{\r\n?}', "\n", $text);
00261 
00262                 # Make sure $text ends with a couple of newlines:
00263                 $text .= "\n\n";
00264 
00265                 # Convert all tabs to spaces.
00266                 $text = $this->detab($text);
00267 
00268                 # Turn block-level HTML blocks into hash entries
00269                 $text = $this->hashHTMLBlocks($text);
00270 
00271                 # Strip any lines consisting only of spaces and tabs.
00272                 # This makes subsequent regexen easier to write, because we can
00273                 # match consecutive blank lines with /\n+/ instead of something
00274                 # contorted like /[ ]*\n+/ .
00275                 $text = preg_replace('/^[ ]+$/m', '', $text);
00276 
00277                 # Run document gamut methods.
00278                 foreach ($this->document_gamut as $method => $priority) {
00279                         $text = $this->$method($text);
00280                 }
00281 
00282                 return $text . "\n";
00283         }
00284         
00285         var $document_gamut = array(
00286                 # Strip link definitions, store in hashes.
00287                 "stripLinkDefinitions" => 20,
00288                 
00289                 "runBasicBlockGamut"   => 30,
00290                 );
00291 
00292 
00293         function stripLinkDefinitions($text) {
00294         #
00295         # Strips link definitions from text, stores the URLs and titles in
00296         # hash references.
00297         #
00298                 $less_than_tab = $this->tab_width - 1;
00299 
00300                 # Link defs are in the form: ^[id]: url "optional title"
00301                 $text = preg_replace_callback('{
00302                                                         ^[ ]{0,'.$less_than_tab.'}\[(.+)\][ ]?: # id = $1
00303                                                           [ ]*
00304                                                           \n?                           # maybe *one* newline
00305                                                           [ ]*
00306                                                         <?(\S+?)>?                      # url = $2
00307                                                           [ ]*
00308                                                           \n?                           # maybe one newline
00309                                                           [ ]*
00310                                                         (?:
00311                                                                 (?<=\s)                 # lookbehind for whitespace
00312                                                                 ["(]
00313                                                                 (.*?)                   # title = $3
00314                                                                 [")]
00315                                                                 [ ]*
00316                                                         )?      # title is optional
00317                                                         (?:\n+|\Z)
00318                         }xm',
00319                         array(&$this, '_stripLinkDefinitions_callback'),
00320                         $text);
00321                 return $text;
00322         }
00323         function _stripLinkDefinitions_callback($matches) {
00324                 $link_id = strtolower($matches[1]);
00325                 $this->urls[$link_id] = $this->encodeAmpsAndAngles($matches[2]);
00326                 if (isset($matches[3]))
00327                         $this->titles[$link_id] = str_replace('"', '&quot;', $matches[3]);
00328                 return ''; # String that will replace the block
00329         }
00330 
00331 
00332         function hashHTMLBlocks($text) {
00333                 if ($this->no_markup)  return $text;
00334 
00335                 $less_than_tab = $this->tab_width - 1;
00336 
00337                 # Hashify HTML blocks:
00338                 # We only want to do this for block-level HTML tags, such as headers,
00339                 # lists, and tables. That's because we still want to wrap <p>s around
00340                 # "paragraphs" that are wrapped in non-block-level tags, such as anchors,
00341                 # phrase emphasis, and spans. The list of tags we're looking for is
00342                 # hard-coded:
00343                 #
00344                 # *  List "a" is made of tags which can be both inline or block-level.
00345                 #    These will be treated block-level when the start tag is alone on 
00346                 #    its line, otherwise they're not matched here and will be taken as 
00347                 #    inline later.
00348                 # *  List "b" is made of tags which are always block-level;
00349                 #
00350                 $block_tags_a = 'ins|del';
00351                 $block_tags_b = 'p|div|h[1-6]|blockquote|pre|table|dl|ol|ul|address|'.
00352                                                 'script|noscript|form|fieldset|iframe|math';
00353 
00354                 # Regular expression for the content of a block tag.
00355                 $nested_tags_level = 4;
00356                 $attr = '
00357                         (?>                             # optional tag attributes
00358                           \s                    # starts with whitespace
00359                           (?>
00360                                 [^>"/]+         # text outside quotes
00361                           |
00362                                 /+(?!>)         # slash not followed by ">"
00363                           |
00364                                 "[^"]*"         # text inside double quotes (tolerate ">")
00365                           |
00366                                 \'[^\']*\'      # text inside single quotes (tolerate ">")
00367                           )*
00368                         )?      
00369                         ';
00370                 $content =
00371                         str_repeat('
00372                                 (?>
00373                                   [^<]+                 # content without tag
00374                                 |
00375                                   <\2                   # nested opening tag
00376                                         '.$attr.'       # attributes
00377                                         (?>
00378                                           />
00379                                         |
00380                                           >', $nested_tags_level).      # end of opening tag
00381                                           '.*?'.                                        # last level nested tag content
00382                         str_repeat('
00383                                           </\2\s*>      # closing nested tag
00384                                         )
00385                                   |                             
00386                                         <(?!/\2\s*>     # other tags with a different name
00387                                   )
00388                                 )*',
00389                                 $nested_tags_level);
00390                 $content2 = str_replace('\2', '\3', $content);
00391 
00392                 # First, look for nested blocks, e.g.:
00393                 #       <div>
00394                 #               <div>
00395                 #               tags for inner block must be indented.
00396                 #               </div>
00397                 #       </div>
00398                 #
00399                 # The outermost tags must start at the left margin for this to match, and
00400                 # the inner nested divs must be indented.
00401                 # We need to do this before the next, more liberal match, because the next
00402                 # match will start at the first `<div>` and stop at the first `</div>`.
00403                 $text = preg_replace_callback('{(?>
00404                         (?>
00405                                 (?<=\n\n)               # Starting after a blank line
00406                                 |                               # or
00407                                 \A\n?                   # the beginning of the doc
00408                         )
00409                         (                                               # save in $1
00410 
00411                           # Match from `\n<tag>` to `</tag>\n`, handling nested tags 
00412                           # in between.
00413                                         
00414                                                 [ ]{0,'.$less_than_tab.'}
00415                                                 <('.$block_tags_b.')# start tag = $2
00416                                                 '.$attr.'>                      # attributes followed by > and \n
00417                                                 '.$content.'            # content, support nesting
00418                                                 </\2>                           # the matching end tag
00419                                                 [ ]*                            # trailing spaces/tabs
00420                                                 (?=\n+|\Z)      # followed by a newline or end of document
00421 
00422                         | # Special version for tags of group a.
00423 
00424                                                 [ ]{0,'.$less_than_tab.'}
00425                                                 <('.$block_tags_a.')# start tag = $3
00426                                                 '.$attr.'>[ ]*\n        # attributes followed by >
00427                                                 '.$content2.'           # content, support nesting
00428                                                 </\3>                           # the matching end tag
00429                                                 [ ]*                            # trailing spaces/tabs
00430                                                 (?=\n+|\Z)      # followed by a newline or end of document
00431                                         
00432                         | # Special case just for <hr />. It was easier to make a special 
00433                           # case than to make the other regex more complicated.
00434                         
00435                                                 [ ]{0,'.$less_than_tab.'}
00436                                                 <(hr)                           # start tag = $2
00437                                                 \b                                      # word break
00438                                                 ([^<>])*?                       # 
00439                                                 /?>                                     # the matching end tag
00440                                                 [ ]*
00441                                                 (?=\n{2,}|\Z)           # followed by a blank line or end of document
00442                         
00443                         | # Special case for standalone HTML comments:
00444                         
00445                                         [ ]{0,'.$less_than_tab.'}
00446                                         (?s:
00447                                                 <!-- .*? -->
00448                                         )
00449                                         [ ]*
00450                                         (?=\n{2,}|\Z)           # followed by a blank line or end of document
00451                         
00452                         | # PHP and ASP-style processor instructions (<? and <%)
00453                         
00454                                         [ ]{0,'.$less_than_tab.'}
00455                                         (?s:
00456                                                 <([?%])                 # $2
00457                                                 .*?
00458                                                 \2>
00459                                         )
00460                                         [ ]*
00461                                         (?=\n{2,}|\Z)           # followed by a blank line or end of document
00462                                         
00463                         )
00464                         )}Sxmi',
00465                         array(&$this, '_hashHTMLBlocks_callback'),
00466                         $text);
00467 
00468                 return $text;
00469         }
00470         function _hashHTMLBlocks_callback($matches) {
00471                 $text = $matches[1];
00472                 $key  = $this->hashBlock($text);
00473                 return "\n\n$key\n\n";
00474         }
00475         
00476         
00477         function hashPart($text, $boundary = 'X') {
00478         #
00479         # Called whenever a tag must be hashed when a function insert an atomic 
00480         # element in the text stream. Passing $text to through this function gives
00481         # a unique text-token which will be reverted back when calling unhash.
00482         #
00483         # The $boundary argument specify what character should be used to surround
00484         # the token. By convension, "B" is used for block elements that needs not
00485         # to be wrapped into paragraph tags at the end, ":" is used for elements
00486         # that are word separators and "S" is used for general span-level elements.
00487         #
00488                 # Swap back any tag hash found in $text so we do not have to `unhash`
00489                 # multiple times at the end.
00490                 $text = $this->unhash($text);
00491                 
00492                 # Then hash the block.
00493                 static $i = 0;
00494                 $key = "$boundary\x1A" . ++$i . $boundary;
00495                 $this->html_hashes[$key] = $text;
00496                 return $key; # String that will replace the tag.
00497         }
00498 
00499 
00500         function hashBlock($text) {
00501         #
00502         # Shortcut function for hashPart with block-level boundaries.
00503         #
00504                 return $this->hashPart($text, 'B');
00505         }
00506 
00507 
00508         var $block_gamut = array(
00509         #
00510         # These are all the transformations that form block-level
00511         # tags like paragraphs, headers, and list items.
00512         #
00513                 "doHeaders"         => 10,
00514                 "doHorizontalRules" => 20,
00515                 
00516                 "doLists"           => 40,
00517                 "doCodeBlocks"      => 50,
00518                 "doBlockQuotes"     => 60,
00519                 );
00520 
00521         function runBlockGamut($text) {
00522         #
00523         # Run block gamut tranformations.
00524         #
00525                 # We need to escape raw HTML in Markdown source before doing anything 
00526                 # else. This need to be done for each block, and not only at the 
00527                 # begining in the Markdown function since hashed blocks can be part of
00528                 # list items and could have been indented. Indented blocks would have 
00529                 # been seen as a code block in a previous pass of hashHTMLBlocks.
00530                 $text = $this->hashHTMLBlocks($text);
00531                 
00532                 return $this->runBasicBlockGamut($text);
00533         }
00534         
00535         function runBasicBlockGamut($text) {
00536         #
00537         # Run block gamut tranformations, without hashing HTML blocks. This is 
00538         # useful when HTML blocks are known to be already hashed, like in the first
00539         # whole-document pass.
00540         #
00541                 foreach ($this->block_gamut as $method => $priority) {
00542                         $text = $this->$method($text);
00543                 }
00544                 
00545                 # Finally form paragraph and restore hashed blocks.
00546                 $text = $this->formParagraphs($text);
00547 
00548                 return $text;
00549         }
00550         
00551         
00552         function doHorizontalRules($text) {
00553                 # Do Horizontal Rules:
00554                 return preg_replace(
00555                         '{
00556                                 ^[ ]{0,3}       # Leading space
00557                                 ([-*_])         # $1: First marker
00558                                 (?>                     # Repeated marker group
00559                                         [ ]{0,2}        # Zero, one, or two spaces.
00560                                         \1                      # Marker character
00561                                 ){2,}           # Group repeated at least twice
00562                                 [ ]*            # Tailing spaces
00563                                 $                       # End of line.
00564                         }mx',
00565                         "\n".$this->hashBlock("<hr$this->empty_element_suffix")."\n", 
00566                         $text);
00567         }
00568 
00569 
00570         var $span_gamut = array(
00571         #
00572         # These are all the transformations that occur *within* block-level
00573         # tags like paragraphs, headers, and list items.
00574         #
00575                 # Process character escapes, code spans, and inline HTML
00576                 # in one shot.
00577                 "parseSpan"           => -30,
00578 
00579                 # Process anchor and image tags. Images must come first,
00580                 # because ![foo][f] looks like an anchor.
00581                 "doImages"            =>  10,
00582                 "doAnchors"           =>  20,
00583                 
00584                 # Make links out of things like `<http://example.com/>`
00585                 # Must come after doAnchors, because you can use < and >
00586                 # delimiters in inline links like [this](<url>).
00587                 "doAutoLinks"         =>  30,
00588                 "encodeAmpsAndAngles" =>  40,
00589 
00590                 "doItalicsAndBold"    =>  50,
00591                 "doHardBreaks"        =>  60,
00592                 );
00593 
00594         function runSpanGamut($text) {
00595         #
00596         # Run span gamut tranformations.
00597         #
00598                 foreach ($this->span_gamut as $method => $priority) {
00599                         $text = $this->$method($text);
00600                 }
00601 
00602                 return $text;
00603         }
00604         
00605         
00606         function doHardBreaks($text) {
00607                 # Do hard breaks:
00608                 return preg_replace_callback('/ {2,}\n/', 
00609                         array(&$this, '_doHardBreaks_callback'), $text);
00610         }
00611         function _doHardBreaks_callback($matches) {
00612                 return $this->hashPart("<br$this->empty_element_suffix\n");
00613         }
00614 
00615 
00616         function doAnchors($text) {
00617         #
00618         # Turn Markdown link shortcuts into XHTML <a> tags.
00619         #
00620                 if ($this->in_anchor) return $text;
00621                 $this->in_anchor = true;
00622                 
00623                 #
00624                 # First, handle reference-style links: [link text] [id]
00625                 #
00626                 $text = preg_replace_callback('{
00627                         (                                       # wrap whole match in $1
00628                           \[
00629                                 ('.$this->nested_brackets.')    # link text = $2
00630                           \]
00631 
00632                           [ ]?                          # one optional space
00633                           (?:\n[ ]*)?           # one optional newline followed by spaces
00634 
00635                           \[
00636                                 (.*?)           # id = $3
00637                           \]
00638                         )
00639                         }xs',
00640                         array(&$this, '_doAnchors_reference_callback'), $text);
00641 
00642                 #
00643                 # Next, inline-style links: [link text](url "optional title")
00644                 #
00645                 $text = preg_replace_callback('{
00646                         (                               # wrap whole match in $1
00647                           \[
00648                                 ('.$this->nested_brackets.')    # link text = $2
00649                           \]
00650                           \(                    # literal paren
00651                                 [ ]*
00652                                 (?:
00653                                         <(\S*)> # href = $3
00654                                 |
00655                                         ('.$this->nested_url_parenthesis.')     # href = $4
00656                                 )
00657                                 [ ]*
00658                                 (                       # $5
00659                                   ([\'"])       # quote char = $6
00660                                   (.*?)         # Title = $7
00661                                   \6            # matching quote
00662                                   [ ]*  # ignore any spaces/tabs between closing quote and )
00663                                 )?                      # title is optional
00664                           \)
00665                         )
00666                         }xs',
00667                         array(&$this, '_DoAnchors_inline_callback'), $text);
00668 
00669                 #
00670                 # Last, handle reference-style shortcuts: [link text]
00671                 # These must come last in case you've also got [link test][1]
00672                 # or [link test](/foo)
00673                 #
00674 //              $text = preg_replace_callback('{
00675 //                      (                                       # wrap whole match in $1
00676 //                        \[
00677 //                              ([^\[\]]+)              # link text = $2; can\'t contain [ or ]
00678 //                        \]
00679 //                      )
00680 //                      }xs',
00681 //                      array(&$this, '_doAnchors_reference_callback'), $text);
00682 
00683                 $this->in_anchor = false;
00684                 return $text;
00685         }
00686         function _doAnchors_reference_callback($matches) {
00687                 $whole_match =  $matches[1];
00688                 $link_text   =  $matches[2];
00689                 $link_id     =& $matches[3];
00690 
00691                 if ($link_id == "") {
00692                         # for shortcut links like [this][] or [this].
00693                         $link_id = $link_text;
00694                 }
00695                 
00696                 # lower-case and turn embedded newlines into spaces
00697                 $link_id = strtolower($link_id);
00698                 $link_id = preg_replace('{[ ]?\n}', ' ', $link_id);
00699 
00700                 if (isset($this->urls[$link_id])) {
00701                         $url = $this->urls[$link_id];
00702                         $url = $this->encodeAmpsAndAngles($url);
00703                         
00704                         $result = "<a href=\"$url\"";
00705                         if ( isset( $this->titles[$link_id] ) ) {
00706                                 $title = $this->titles[$link_id];
00707                                 $title = $this->encodeAmpsAndAngles($title);
00708                                 $result .=  " title=\"$title\"";
00709                         }
00710                 
00711                         $link_text = $this->runSpanGamut($link_text);
00712                         $result .= ">$link_text</a>";
00713                         $result = $this->hashPart($result);
00714                 }
00715                 else {
00716                         $result = $whole_match;
00717                 }
00718                 return $result;
00719         }
00720         function _doAnchors_inline_callback($matches) {
00721                 $whole_match    =  $matches[1];
00722                 $link_text              =  $this->runSpanGamut($matches[2]);
00723                 $url                    =  $matches[3] == '' ? $matches[4] : $matches[3];
00724                 $title                  =& $matches[7];
00725 
00726                 $url = $this->encodeAmpsAndAngles($url);
00727 
00728                 $result = "<a href=\"$url\"";
00729                 if (isset($title)) {
00730                         $title = str_replace('"', '&quot;', $title);
00731                         $title = $this->encodeAmpsAndAngles($title);
00732                         $result .=  " title=\"$title\"";
00733                 }
00734                 
00735                 $link_text = $this->runSpanGamut($link_text);
00736                 $result .= ">$link_text</a>";
00737 
00738                 return $this->hashPart($result);
00739         }
00740 
00741 
00742         function doImages($text) {
00743         #
00744         # Turn Markdown image shortcuts into <img> tags.
00745         #
00746                 #
00747                 # First, handle reference-style labeled images: ![alt text][id]
00748                 #
00749                 $text = preg_replace_callback('{
00750                         (                               # wrap whole match in $1
00751                           !\[
00752                                 ('.$this->nested_brackets.')            # alt text = $2
00753                           \]
00754 
00755                           [ ]?                          # one optional space
00756                           (?:\n[ ]*)?           # one optional newline followed by spaces
00757 
00758                           \[
00759                                 (.*?)           # id = $3
00760                           \]
00761 
00762                         )
00763                         }xs', 
00764                         array(&$this, '_doImages_reference_callback'), $text);
00765 
00766                 #
00767                 # Next, handle inline images:  ![alt text](url "optional title")
00768                 # Don't forget: encode * and _
00769                 #
00770                 $text = preg_replace_callback('{
00771                         (                               # wrap whole match in $1
00772                           !\[
00773                                 ('.$this->nested_brackets.')            # alt text = $2
00774                           \]
00775                           \s?                   # One optional whitespace character
00776                           \(                    # literal paren
00777                                 [ ]*
00778                                 (?:
00779                                         <(\S*)> # src url = $3
00780                                 |
00781                                         ('.$this->nested_url_parenthesis.')     # src url = $4
00782                                 )
00783                                 [ ]*
00784                                 (                       # $5
00785                                   ([\'"])       # quote char = $6
00786                                   (.*?)         # title = $7
00787                                   \6            # matching quote
00788                                   [ ]*
00789                                 )?                      # title is optional
00790                           \)
00791                         )
00792                         }xs',
00793                         array(&$this, '_doImages_inline_callback'), $text);
00794 
00795                 return $text;
00796         }
00797         function _doImages_reference_callback($matches) {
00798                 $whole_match = $matches[1];
00799                 $alt_text    = $matches[2];
00800                 $link_id     = strtolower($matches[3]);
00801 
00802                 if ($link_id == "") {
00803                         $link_id = strtolower($alt_text); # for shortcut links like ![this][].
00804                 }
00805 
00806                 $alt_text = str_replace('"', '&quot;', $alt_text);
00807                 if (isset($this->urls[$link_id])) {
00808                         $url = $this->urls[$link_id];
00809                         $result = "<img src=\"$url\" alt=\"$alt_text\"";
00810                         if (isset($this->titles[$link_id])) {
00811                                 $title = $this->titles[$link_id];
00812                                 $result .=  " title=\"$title\"";
00813                         }
00814                         $result .= $this->empty_element_suffix;
00815                         $result = $this->hashPart($result);
00816                 }
00817                 else {
00818                         # If there's no such link ID, leave intact:
00819                         $result = $whole_match;
00820                 }
00821 
00822                 return $result;
00823         }
00824         function _doImages_inline_callback($matches) {
00825                 $whole_match    = $matches[1];
00826                 $alt_text               = $matches[2];
00827                 $url                    = $matches[3] == '' ? $matches[4] : $matches[3];
00828                 $title                  =& $matches[7];
00829 
00830                 $alt_text = str_replace('"', '&quot;', $alt_text);
00831                 $result = "<img src=\"$url\" alt=\"$alt_text\"";
00832                 if (isset($title)) {
00833                         $title = str_replace('"', '&quot;', $title);
00834                         $result .=  " title=\"$title\""; # $title already quoted
00835                 }
00836                 $result .= $this->empty_element_suffix;
00837 
00838                 return $this->hashPart($result);
00839         }

00841 
00842         function doHeaders($text) {
00843                 # Setext-style headers:
00844                 #         Header 1
00845                 #         ========
00846                 #  
00847                 #         Header 2
00848                 #         --------
00849                 #
00850                 $text = preg_replace_callback('{ ^(.+?)[ ]*\n(=+|-+)[ ]*\n+ }mx',
00851                         array(&$this, '_doHeaders_callback_setext'), $text);
00852 
00853                 # atx-style headers:
00854                 #       # Header 1
00855                 #       ## Header 2
00856                 #       ## Header 2 with closing hashes ##
00857                 #       ...
00858                 #       ###### Header 6
00859                 #
00860                 $text = preg_replace_callback('{
00861                                 ^(\#{1,6})      # $1 = string of #\'s
00862                                 [ ]*
00863                                 (.+?)           # $2 = Header text
00864                                 [ ]*
00865                                 \#*                     # optional closing #\'s (not counted)
00866                                 \n+
00867                         }xm',
00868                         array(&$this, '_doHeaders_callback_atx'), $text);
00869 
00870                 return $text;
00871         }
00872         function _doHeaders_callback_setext($matches) {
00873                 $level = $matches[2]{0} == '=' ? 1 : 2;
00874                 $block = "<h$level>".$this->runSpanGamut($matches[1])."</h$level>";
00875                 return "\n" . $this->hashBlock($block) . "\n\n";
00876         }
00877         function _doHeaders_callback_atx($matches) {
00878                 $level = strlen($matches[1]);
00879                 $block = "<h$level>".$this->runSpanGamut($matches[2])."</h$level>";
00880                 return "\n" . $this->hashBlock($block) . "\n\n";
00881         }
00882 
00883 
00884         function doLists($text) {
00885         #
00886         # Form HTML ordered (numbered) and unordered (bulleted) lists.
00887         #
00888                 $less_than_tab = $this->tab_width - 1;
00889 
00890                 # Re-usable patterns to match list item bullets and number markers:
00891                 $marker_ul  = '[*+-]';
00892                 $marker_ol  = '\d+[.]';
00893                 $marker_any = "(?:$marker_ul|$marker_ol)";
00894 
00895                 $markers = array($marker_ul, $marker_ol);
00896 
00897                 foreach ($markers as $marker) {
00898                         # Re-usable pattern to match any entirel ul or ol list:
00899                         $whole_list = '
00900                                 (                                                               # $1 = whole list
00901                                   (                                                             # $2
00902                                         [ ]{0,'.$less_than_tab.'}
00903                                         ('.$marker.')                           # $3 = first list item marker
00904                                         [ ]+
00905                                   )
00906                                   (?s:.+?)
00907                                   (                                                             # $4
00908                                           \z
00909                                         |
00910                                           \n{2,}
00911                                           (?=\S)
00912                                           (?!                                           # Negative lookahead for another list item marker
00913                                                 [ ]*
00914                                                 '.$marker.'[ ]+
00915                                           )
00916                                   )
00917                                 )
00918                         '; // mx
00919                         
00920                         # We use a different prefix before nested lists than top-level lists.
00921                         # See extended comment in _ProcessListItems().
00922                 
00923                         if ($this->list_level) {
00924                                 $text = preg_replace_callback('{
00925                                                 ^
00926                                                 '.$whole_list.'
00927                                         }mx',
00928                                         array(&$this, '_doLists_callback'), $text);
00929                         }
00930                         else {
00931                                 $text = preg_replace_callback('{
00932                                                 (?:(?<=\n)\n|\A\n?) # Must eat the newline
00933                                                 '.$whole_list.'
00934                                         }mx',
00935                                         array(&$this, '_doLists_callback'), $text);
00936                         }
00937                 }
00938 
00939                 return $text;
00940         }
00941         function _doLists_callback($matches) {
00942                 # Re-usable patterns to match list item bullets and number markers:
00943                 $marker_ul  = '[*+-]';
00944                 $marker_ol  = '\d+[.]';
00945                 $marker_any = "(?:$marker_ul|$marker_ol)";
00946                 
00947                 $list = $matches[1];
00948                 $list_type = preg_match("/$marker_ul/", $matches[3]) ? "ul" : "ol";
00949                 
00950                 $marker_any = ( $list_type == "ul" ? $marker_ul : $marker_ol );
00951                 
00952                 $list .= "\n";
00953                 $result = $this->processListItems($list, $marker_any);
00954                 
00955                 $result = $this->hashBlock("<$list_type>\n" . $result . "</$list_type>");
00956                 return "\n". $result ."\n\n";
00957         }
00958 
00959         var $list_level = 0;
00960 
00961         function processListItems($list_str, $marker_any) {
00962         #
00963         #       Process the contents of a single ordered or unordered list, splitting it
00964         #       into individual list items.
00965         #
00966                 # The $this->list_level global keeps track of when we're inside a list.
00967                 # Each time we enter a list, we increment it; when we leave a list,
00968                 # we decrement. If it's zero, we're not in a list anymore.
00969                 #
00970                 # We do this because when we're not inside a list, we want to treat
00971                 # something like this:
00972                 #
00973                 #               I recommend upgrading to version
00974                 #               8. Oops, now this line is treated
00975                 #               as a sub-list.
00976                 #
00977                 # As a single paragraph, despite the fact that the second line starts
00978                 # with a digit-period-space sequence.
00979                 #
00980                 # Whereas when we're inside a list (or sub-list), that line will be
00981                 # treated as the start of a sub-list. What a kludge, huh? This is
00982                 # an aspect of Markdown's syntax that's hard to parse perfectly
00983                 # without resorting to mind-reading. Perhaps the solution is to
00984                 # change the syntax rules such that sub-lists must start with a
00985                 # starting cardinal number; e.g. "1." or "a.".
00986                 
00987                 $this->list_level++;
00988 
00989                 # trim trailing blank lines:
00990                 $list_str = preg_replace("/\n{2,}\\z/", "\n", $list_str);
00991 
00992                 $list_str = preg_replace_callback('{
00993                         (\n)?                                                   # leading line = $1
00994                         (^[ ]*)                                         # leading whitespace = $2
00995                         ('.$marker_any.') [ ]+          # list marker = $3
00996                         ((?s:.+?))                                              # list item text   = $4
00997                         (?:(\n+(?=\n))|\n)                              # tailing blank line = $5
00998                         (?= \n* (\z | \2 ('.$marker_any.') [ ]+))
00999                         }xm',
01000                         array(&$this, '_processListItems_callback'), $list_str);
01001 
01002                 $this->list_level--;
01003                 return $list_str;
01004         }
01005         function _processListItems_callback($matches) {
01006                 $item = $matches[4];
01007                 $leading_line =& $matches[1];
01008                 $leading_space =& $matches[2];
01009                 $tailing_blank_line =& $matches[5];
01010 
01011                 if ($leading_line || $tailing_blank_line || 
01012                         preg_match('/\n{2,}/', $item))
01013                 {
01014                         $item = $this->runBlockGamut($this->outdent($item)."\n");
01015                 }
01016                 else {
01017                         # Recursion for sub-lists:
01018                         $item = $this->doLists($this->outdent($item));
01019                         $item = preg_replace('/\n+$/', '', $item);
01020                         $item = $this->runSpanGamut($item);
01021                 }
01022 
01023                 return "<li>" . $item . "</li>\n";
01024         }
01025 
01026 
01027         function doCodeBlocks($text) {
01028         #
01029         #       Process Markdown `<pre><code>` blocks.
01030         #
01031                 $text = preg_replace_callback('{
01032                                 (?:\n\n|\A)
01033                                 (                   # $1 = the code block -- one or more lines, starting with a space/tab
01034                                   (?>
01035                                         [ ]{'.$this->tab_width.'}  # Lines must start with a tab or a tab-width of spaces
01036                                         .*\n+
01037                                   )+
01038                                 )
01039                                 ((?=^[ ]{0,'.$this->tab_width.'}\S)|\Z) # Lookahead for non-space at line-start, or end of doc
01040                         }xm',
01041                         array(&$this, '_doCodeBlocks_callback'), $text);
01042 
01043                 return $text;
01044         }
01045         function _doCodeBlocks_callback($matches) {
01046                 $codeblock = $matches[1];
01047 
01048                 $codeblock = $this->outdent($codeblock);
01049                 $codeblock = htmlspecialchars($codeblock, ENT_NOQUOTES);
01050 
01051                 # trim leading newlines and trailing newlines
01052                 $codeblock = preg_replace('/\A\n+|\n+\z/', '', $codeblock);
01053 
01054                 $codeblock = "<pre><code>$codeblock\n</code></pre>";
01055                 return "\n\n".$this->hashBlock($codeblock)."\n\n";
01056         }
01057 
01058 
01059         function makeCodeSpan($code) {
01060         #
01061         # Create a code span markup for $code. Called from handleSpanToken.
01062         #
01063                 $code = htmlspecialchars(trim($code), ENT_NOQUOTES);
01064                 return $this->hashPart("<code>$code</code>");
01065         }

01067 
01068         function doItalicsAndBold($text) {
01069                 # <strong> must go first:
01070                 $text = preg_replace_callback('{
01071                                 (                                               # $1: Marker
01072                                         (?<!\*\*) \* |          #     (not preceded by two chars of
01073                                         (?<!__)   _                     #      the same marker)
01074                                 )
01075                                 \1
01076                                 (?=\S)                                  # Not followed by whitespace 
01077                                 (?!\1\1)                                #   or two others marker chars.
01078                                 (                                               # $2: Content
01079                                         (?>
01080                                                 [^*_]+?                 # Anthing not em markers.
01081                                         |
01082                                                                                 # Balence any regular emphasis inside.
01083                                                 \1 (?=\S) .+? (?<=\S) \1
01084                                         |
01085                                                 .                               # Allow unbalenced * and _.
01086                                         )+?
01087                                 )
01088                                 (?<=\S) \1\1                    # End mark not preceded by whitespace.
01089                         }sx',
01090                         array(&$this, '_doItalicAndBold_strong_callback'), $text);
01091                 # Then <em>:
01092                 $text = preg_replace_callback(
01093                         '{ ( (?<!\*)\* | (?<!_)_ ) (?=\S) (?! \1) (.+?) (?<=\S)(?<!\s(?=\1).) \1 }sx',
01094                         array(&$this, '_doItalicAndBold_em_callback'), $text);
01095 
01096                 return $text;
01097         }
01098         function _doItalicAndBold_em_callback($matches) {
01099                 $text = $matches[2];
01100                 $text = $this->runSpanGamut($text);
01101                 return $this->hashPart("<em>$text</em>");
01102         }
01103         function _doItalicAndBold_strong_callback($matches) {
01104                 $text = $matches[2];
01105                 $text = $this->runSpanGamut($text);
01106                 return $this->hashPart("<strong>$text</strong>");
01107         }
01108 
01109 
01110         function doBlockQuotes($text) {
01111                 $text = preg_replace_callback('/
01112                           (                                                             # Wrap whole match in $1
01113                                 (?>
01114                                   ^[ ]*>[ ]?                    # ">" at the start of a line
01115                                         .+\n                                    # rest of the first line
01116                                   (.+\n)*                                       # subsequent consecutive lines
01117                                   \n*                                           # blanks
01118                                 )+
01119                           )
01120                         /xm',
01121                         array(&$this, '_doBlockQuotes_callback'), $text);
01122 
01123                 return $text;
01124         }
01125         function _doBlockQuotes_callback($matches) {
01126                 $bq = $matches[1];
01127                 # trim one level of quoting - trim whitespace-only lines
01128                 $bq = preg_replace('/^[ ]*>[ ]?|^[ ]+$/m', '', $bq);
01129                 $bq = $this->runBlockGamut($bq);                # recurse
01130 
01131                 $bq = preg_replace('/^/m', "  ", $bq);
01132                 # These leading spaces cause problem with <pre> content, 
01133                 # so we need to fix that:
01134                 $bq = preg_replace_callback('{(\s*<pre>.+?</pre>)}sx', 
01135                         array(&$this, '_DoBlockQuotes_callback2'), $bq);
01136 
01137                 return "\n". $this->hashBlock("<blockquote>\n$bq\n</blockquote>")."\n\n";
01138         }
01139         function _doBlockQuotes_callback2($matches) {
01140                 $pre = $matches[1];
01141                 $pre = preg_replace('/^  /m', '', $pre);
01142                 return $pre;
01143         }
01144 
01145 
01146         function formParagraphs($text) {
01147         #
01148         #       Params:
01149         #               $text - string to process with html <p> tags
01150         #
01151                 # Strip leading and trailing lines:
01152                 $text = preg_replace('/\A\n+|\n+\z/', '', $text);
01153 
01154                 $grafs = preg_split('/\n{2,}/', $text, -1, PREG_SPLIT_NO_EMPTY);
01155 
01156                 #
01157                 # Wrap <p> tags and unhashify HTML blocks
01158                 #
01159                 foreach ($grafs as $key => $value) {
01160                         if (!preg_match('/^B\x1A[0-9]+B$/', $value)) {
01161                                 # Is a paragraph.
01162                                 $value = $this->runSpanGamut($value);
01163                                 $value = preg_replace('/^([ ]*)/', "<p>", $value);
01164                                 $value .= "</p>";
01165                                 $grafs[$key] = $this->unhash($value);
01166                         }
01167                         else {
01168                                 # Is a block.
01169                                 # Modify elements of @grafs in-place...
01170                                 $graf = $value;
01171                                 $block = $this->html_hashes[$graf];
01172                                 $graf = $block;
01173 //                              if (preg_match('{
01174 //                                      \A
01175 //                                      (                                                       # $1 = <div> tag
01176 //                                        <div  \s+
01177 //                                        [^>]*
01178 //                                        \b
01179 //                                        markdown\s*=\s*  ([\'"])      #       $2 = attr quote char
01180 //                                        1
01181 //                                        \2
01182 //                                        [^>]*
01183 //                                        >
01184 //                                      )
01185 //                                      (                                                       # $3 = contents
01186 //                                      .*
01187 //                                      )
01188 //                                      (</div>)                                        # $4 = closing tag
01189 //                                      \z
01190 //                                      }xs', $block, $matches))
01191 //                              {
01192 //                                      list(, $div_open, , $div_content, $div_close) = $matches;
01193 //
01194 //                                      # We can't call Markdown(), because that resets the hash;
01195 //                                      # that initialization code should be pulled into its own sub, though.
01196 //                                      $div_content = $this->hashHTMLBlocks($div_content);
01197 //                                      
01198 //                                      # Run document gamut methods on the content.
01199 //                                      foreach ($this->document_gamut as $method => $priority) {
01200 //                                              $div_content = $this->$method($div_content);
01201 //                                      }
01202 //
01203 //                                      $div_open = preg_replace(
01204 //                                              '{\smarkdown\s*=\s*([\'"]).+?\1}', '', $div_open);
01205 //
01206 //                                      $graf = $div_open . "\n" . $div_content . "\n" . $div_close;
01207 //                              }
01208                                 $grafs[$key] = $graf;
01209                         }
01210                 }
01211 
01212                 return implode("\n\n", $grafs);
01213         }
01214 
01215 
01216         function encodeAmpsAndAngles($text) {
01217         # Smart processing for ampersands and angle brackets that need to be encoded.
01218                 if ($this->no_entities) {
01219                         $text = str_replace('&', '&amp;', $text);
01220                         $text = str_replace('<', '&lt;', $text);
01221                         return $text;
01222                 }
01223 
01224                 # Ampersand-encoding based entirely on Nat Irons's Amputator MT plugin:
01225                 #   http://bumppo.net/projects/amputator/
01226                 $text = preg_replace('/&(?!#?[xX]?(?:[0-9a-fA-F]+|\w+);)/', 
01227                                                          '&amp;', $text);;
01228 
01229                 # Encode naked <'s
01230                 $text = preg_replace('{<(?![a-z/?\$!%])}i', '&lt;', $text);
01231 
01232                 return $text;
01233         }
01234 
01235 
01236         function doAutoLinks($text) {
01237                 $text = preg_replace_callback('{<((https?|ftp|dict):[^\'">\s]+)>}', 
01238                         array(&$this, '_doAutoLinks_url_callback'), $text);
01239 
01240                 # Email addresses: <address@domain.foo>
01241                 $text = preg_replace_callback('{
01242                         <
01243                         (?:mailto:)?
01244                         (
01245                                 [-.\w\x80-\xFF]+
01246                                 \@
01247                                 [-a-z0-9\x80-\xFF]+(\.[-a-z0-9\x80-\xFF]+)*\.[a-z]+
01248                         )
01249                         >
01250                         }xi',
01251                         array(&$this, '_doAutoLinks_email_callback'), $text);
01252 
01253                 return $text;
01254         }
01255         function _doAutoLinks_url_callback($matches) {
01256                 $url = $this->encodeAmpsAndAngles($matches[1]);
01257                 $link = "<a href=\"$url\">$url</a>";
01258                 return $this->hashPart($link);
01259         }
01260         function _doAutoLinks_email_callback($matches) {
01261                 $address = $matches[1];
01262                 $link = $this->encodeEmailAddress($address);
01263                 return $this->hashPart($link);
01264         }
01265 
01266 
01267         function encodeEmailAddress($addr) {
01268         #
01269         #       Input: an email address, e.g. "foo@example.com"
01270         #
01271         #       Output: the email address as a mailto link, with each character
01272         #               of the address encoded as either a decimal or hex entity, in
01273         #               the hopes of foiling most address harvesting spam bots. E.g.:
01274         #
01275         #         <p><a href="&#109;&#x61;&#105;&#x6c;&#116;&#x6f;&#58;&#x66;o&#111;
01276         #        &#x40;&#101;&#x78;&#97;&#x6d;&#112;&#x6c;&#101;&#46;&#x63;&#111;
01277         #        &#x6d;">&#x66;o&#111;&#x40;&#101;&#x78;&#97;&#x6d;&#112;&#x6c;
01278         #        &#101;&#46;&#x63;&#111;&#x6d;</a></p>
01279         #
01280         #       Based by a filter by Matthew Wickline, posted to BBEdit-Talk.
01281         #   With some optimizations by Milian Wolff.
01282         #
01283                 $addr = "mailto:" . $addr;
01284                 $chars = preg_split('/(?<!^)(?!$)/', $addr);
01285                 $seed = (int)abs(crc32($addr) / strlen($addr)); # Deterministic seed.
01286                 
01287                 foreach ($chars as $key => $char) {
01288                         $ord = ord($char);
01289                         # Ignore non-ascii chars.
01290                         if ($ord < 128) {
01291                                 $r = ($seed * (1 + $key)) % 100; # Pseudo-random function.
01292                                 # roughly 10% raw, 45% hex, 45% dec
01293                                 # '@' *must* be encoded. I insist.
01294                                 if ($r > 90 && $char != '@') /* do nothing */;
01295                                 else if ($r < 45) $chars[$key] = '&#x'.dechex($ord).';';
01296                                 else              $chars[$key] = '&#'.$ord.';';
01297                         }
01298                 }
01299                 
01300                 $addr = implode('', $chars);
01301                 $text = implode('', array_slice($chars, 7)); # text without `mailto:`
01302                 $addr = "<a href=\"$addr\">$text</a>";
01303 
01304                 return $addr;
01305         }
01306 
01307 
01308         function parseSpan($str) {
01309         #
01310         # Take the string $str and parse it into tokens, hashing embeded HTML,
01311         # escaped characters and handling code spans.
01312         #
01313                 $output = '';
01314                 
01315                 $regex = '{
01316                                 (
01317                                         \\\\['.preg_quote($this->escape_chars).']
01318                                 |
01319                                         (?<![`\\\\])
01320                                         `+                                              # code span marker
01321                         '.( $this->no_markup ? '' : '
01322                                 |
01323                                         <!--    .*?     -->             # comment
01324                                 |
01325                                         <\?.*?\?> | <%.*?%>             # processing instruction
01326                                 |
01327                                         <[/!$]?[-a-zA-Z0-9:]+   # regular tags
01328                                         (?>
01329                                                 \s
01330                                                 (?>[^"\'>]+|"[^"]*"|\'[^\']*\')*
01331                                         )?
01332                                         >
01333                         ').'
01334                                 )
01335                                 }xs';
01336 
01337                 while (1) {
01338                         #
01339                         # Each loop iteration seach for either the next tag, the next 
01340                         # openning code span marker, or the next escaped character. 
01341                         # Each token is then passed to handleSpanToken.
01342                         #
01343                         $parts = preg_split($regex, $str, 2, PREG_SPLIT_DELIM_CAPTURE);
01344                         
01345                         # Create token from text preceding tag.
01346                         if ($parts[0] != "") {
01347                                 $output .= $parts[0];
01348                         }
01349                         
01350                         # Check if we reach the end.
01351                         if (isset($parts[1])) {
01352                                 $output .= $this->handleSpanToken($parts[1], $parts[2]);
01353                                 $str = $parts[2];
01354                         }
01355                         else {
01356                                 break;
01357                         }
01358                 }
01359                 
01360                 return $output;
01361         }
01362         
01363         
01364         function handleSpanToken($token, &$str) {
01365         #
01366         # Handle $token provided by parseSpan by determining its nature and 
01367         # returning the corresponding value that should replace it.
01368         #
01369                 switch ($token{0}) {
01370                         case "\\":
01371                                 return $this->hashPart("&#". ord($token{1}). ";");
01372                         case "`":
01373                                 # Search for end marker in remaining text.
01374                                 if (preg_match('/^(.*?[^`])'.$token.'(?!`)(.*)$/sm', 
01375                                         $str, $matches))
01376                                 {
01377                                         $str = $matches[2];
01378                                         $codespan = $this->makeCodeSpan($matches[1]);
01379                                         return $this->hashPart($codespan);
01380                                 }
01381                                 return $token; // return as text since no ending marker found.
01382                         default:
01383                                 return $this->hashPart($token);
01384                 }
01385         }
01386 
01387 
01388         function outdent($text) {
01389         #
01390         # Remove one level of line-leading tabs or spaces
01391         #
01392                 return preg_replace('/^(\t|[ ]{1,'.$this->tab_width.'})/m', '', $text);
01393         }
01394 
01395 
01396         # String length function for detab. `_initDetab` will create a function to 
01397         # hanlde UTF-8 if the default function does not exist.
01398         var $utf8_strlen = 'mb_strlen';
01399         
01400         function detab($text) {
01401         #
01402         # Replace tabs with the appropriate amount of space.
01403         #
01404                 # For each line we separate the line in blocks delemited by
01405                 # tab characters. Then we reconstruct every line by adding the 
01406                 # appropriate number of space between each blocks.
01407                 
01408                 $text = preg_replace_callback('/^.*\t.*$/m',
01409                         array(&$this, '_detab_callback'), $text);
01410 
01411                 return $text;
01412         }
01413         function _detab_callback($matches) {
01414                 $line = $matches[0];
01415                 $strlen = $this->utf8_strlen; # strlen function for UTF-8.
01416                 
01417                 # Split in blocks.
01418                 $blocks = explode("\t", $line);
01419                 # Add each blocks to the line.
01420                 $line = $blocks[0];
01421                 unset($blocks[0]); # Do not add first block twice.
01422                 foreach ($blocks as $block) {
01423                         # Calculate amount of space, insert spaces, insert block.
01424                         $amount = $this->tab_width - 
01425                                 $strlen($line, 'UTF-8') % $this->tab_width;
01426                         $line .= str_repeat(" ", $amount) . $block;
01427                 }
01428                 return $line;
01429         }
01430         function _initDetab() {
01431         #
01432         # Check for the availability of the function in the `utf8_strlen` property
01433         # (initially `mb_strlen`). If the function is not available, create a 
01434         # function that will loosely count the number of UTF-8 characters with a
01435         # regular expression.
01436         #
01437                 if (function_exists($this->utf8_strlen)) return;
01438                 $this->utf8_strlen = create_function('$text', 'return preg_match_all(
01439                         "/[\\\\x00-\\\\xBF]|[\\\\xC0-\\\\xFF][\\\\x80-\\\\xBF]*/", 
01440                         $text, $m);');
01441         }
01442 
01443 
01444         function unhash($text) {
01445         #
01446         # Swap back in all the tags hashed by _HashHTMLBlocks.
01447         #
01448                 return preg_replace_callback('/(.)\x1A[0-9]+\1/', 
01449                         array(&$this, '_unhash_callback'), $text);
01450         }
01451         function _unhash_callback($matches) {
01452                 return $this->html_hashes[$matches[0]];
01453         }
01454 
01455 }

01457 /*
01458 
01459 PHP Markdown
01460 ============
01461 
01462 Description
01463 -----------
01464 
01465 This is a PHP translation of the original Markdown formatter written in
01466 Perl by John Gruber.
01467 
01468 Markdown is a text-to-HTML filter; it translates an easy-to-read /
01469 easy-to-write structured text format into HTML. Markdown's text format
01470 is most similar to that of plain text email, and supports features such
01471 as headers, *emphasis*, code blocks, blockquotes, and links.
01472 
01473 Markdown's syntax is designed not as a generic markup language, but
01474 specifically to serve as a front-end to (X)HTML. You can use span-level
01475 HTML tags anywhere in a Markdown document, and you can use block level
01476 HTML tags (like <div> and <table> as well).
01477 
01478 For more information about Markdown's syntax, see:
01479 
01480 <http://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/>
01481 
01482 
01483 Bugs
01484 ----
01485 
01486 To file bug reports please send email to:
01487 
01488 <michel.fortin@michelf.com>
01489 
01490 Please include with your report: (1) the example input; (2) the output you
01491 expected; (3) the output Markdown actually produced.
01492

01495 ---------------
